extends java.lang.Thread

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This thread will update the "currentSessionTime" on the ihm every 500ms and send image from the robot to the client if a client is logged in.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:

      • processLoggedInUserFace

        public void processLoggedInUserFace(java.lang.String msg)
        This methods processes a received message containing an image (the face of the client trying to log in). If the message is not null or empty if there is a logged client, it convert the message to get the image and updates the database and ihm accordingly.
        Specified by:
        processLoggedInUserFace in interface ItfWrkServerWrk
        Parameters:
        msg - A String, The message containing the image.

      • disconnectClient

        public void disconnectClient(Client client,
                             boolean isLoggedClient)
        Disconnects a specified client. If the boolean is true, that means we are disconnecting the logged client, then it first logs him out. Once logged out, the Ihm is updated.
        Specified by:
        disconnectClient in interface ItfWrkServerWrk
        Parameters:
        client - The client that needs to be disconnected
        isLoggedClient - A boolean defining if the client that needs to be disconnected is the logged one.

      • freezeRobot

        public void freezeRobot()
        Freezes the robot by setting every of it's movement to 0 and sends a message to the logged client if there's one to warn him he can't control the robot anymore.
        Specified by:
        freezeRobot in interface ItfWrkCtrl

      • unfreezeRobot

        public void unfreezeRobot()
        Unfreezes the robot by sending a message to the logged client if there's one to warn him he can control the robot.
        Specified by:
        unfreezeRobot in interface ItfWrkCtrl

      • connectRobot

        public void connectRobot()
        Connects to the robot by asking the robotWrk to do so using a new Thread to prevent the ihm to freeze. Updates the ihm accordingly.
        Specified by:
        connectRobot in interface ItfWrkCtrl

      • initRobot

        public void initRobot()
        Inits the robot by asking the robotWrk to do so using a new Thread to prevent the ihm to freeze.
        Specified by:
        initRobot in interface ItfWrkCtrl

      • takeAndSendRobotPicture

        public void takeAndSendRobotPicture()
        If the robot isn't freezed, get his last taken image and asks the serverWrk to send it to the logged client.
        Specified by:
        takeAndSendRobotPicture in interface ItfWrkSequenceExecutor
        Specified by:
        takeAndSendRobotPicture in interface ItfWrkServerWrk

      • moveRobotHead

        public void moveRobotHead(java.lang.String msg)
        If the robot isn't freezed, processes a message to extract value about the movement of the robot's head. Does so if the msg is no null or empty. If the message has correctly been processed, updates the robot with the new head movement.
        Specified by:
        moveRobotHead in interface ItfWrkServerWrk
        Parameters:
        msg - The received message containing the head movement.

      • moveRobot

        public void moveRobot(java.lang.String msg)
        If the robot isn't freezed, processes a message to extract value about the movement of the robot's body. Does so if the msg is no null or empty. If the message has correctly been processed, updates the robot with the new body movement.
        Specified by:
        moveRobot in interface ItfWrkServerWrk
        Parameters:
        msg - The received message containing the body movement.

      • readSequence

        public void readSequence(java.lang.String msg)
        If the robot isn't freezed and the msg is not null or empty, tries to extract data about a sequence from the msg. If everything has been processed correctly, check if the sequence syntax is correct and start a new Thread to execute it.
        Specified by:
        readSequence in interface ItfWrkServerWrk
        Parameters:
        msg - The message containing the sequence to execute.

      • connectDatabase

        public boolean connectDatabase()
        Tries to connect the server to the database. Displays a message on the console depending on the connection state, success or error
        Specified by:
        connectDatabase in interface ItfWrkCtrl
        Returns:
        True if there the server is connected, false otherwise.

        Disconnects from the database by asking the DatabaseWrk to do so.
        Specified by:
        disconnectDatabase in interface ItfWrkCtrl

      • loginUser

        public void loginUser(java.lang.String msg,
                      Client client)
        Convert a received message into credentials and tries to match it in the database. Update the IHM and the client and warn the client depending on the login result.
        Specified by:
        loginUser in interface ItfWrkServerWrk
        Parameters:
        msg - The received message from the client
        client - The client that sent the message

      • signInUser

        public void signInUser(java.lang.String msg,
                       Client client)
        Creates a new user in the database using credentials extracted from the message received from a client.
        Specified by:
        signInUser in interface ItfWrkServerWrk
        Parameters:
        msg - The received message from the client
        client - The client that sent the message

      • addSequence

        public void addSequence(java.lang.String msg)
        Adds a sequence to the database. If the message is null/emtpy or there's no logged client or the message syntax isn't correct, does nothing. Otherwise, processes the msg and asks the databaseWrk to add a new sequence.
        Specified by:
        addSequence in interface ItfWrkServerWrk
        Parameters:
        msg - The message containing the sequence to add.

      • addUser

        public boolean addUser(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String password)
        Asks the WrkDatabase to create a new User. Writes a message on the console
        Specified by:
        addUser in interface ItfWrkCtrl
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the user
        password - The password of the user (not encrypted)
        Returns:
        True if the user was created successfully, false otherwise.
